contentrichtext.text: {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[File:Hmas murchison.jpg|300px]] |Ship caption=HMAS ''Murchison'' operating off the coast of Korea, circa 1951–52 }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Ship country=Australia |Ship flag={{shipboxflag|Australia|naval-1913}} |Ship namesake=[[Murchison River (Western Australia)|Murchison River]] |Ship builder=[[Evans Deakin and Company]], Brisbane, Queensland |Ship laid down=3 June 1943 |Ship launched=31 October 1944 |Ship commissioned=17 December 1945 |Ship decommissioned=15 April 1954 |Ship motto="With Undaunted Heart" |Ship nickname= |Ship honours='''Battle honours:'''<br />[[Korean War|Korea]] 1951–52 |Ship fate=Sold for scrap |Ship notes= |Ship badge= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Ship class=[[Bay class frigate|Modified River (Bay) class frigate]] |Ship displacement=1,537 tons (standard), 2,200 tons (full load) |Ship length={{convert|301|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|36|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draught={{convert|12|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion=Triple expansion, 2 shafts, 5,500 IHP |Ship speed={{convert|19.5|kn}} |Ship range= |Ship complement=175 |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=4 x 4-inch guns<br />3 x 40 mm Bofors<br />4 x 20 mm Oerlikons<br />1 x Hedgehog<br />4 x Depth Charge Throwers |Ship notes= }} |} '''HMAS ''Murchison'' (K442/F442)''' was a Modified River (or [[Bay class frigate]] of the [[Royal Australian Navy]] (RAN). The ship was laid down in 1943, but not commissioned until after the end of [[World War II]]. ''Murchison'' fought in the [[Korean War]], was decommissioned in 1956, and sold for scrap in 1961. ==Construction== ''Murchison'' was one of four Bay class frigates constructed in [[Australia]] during World War II, being laid down by [[Evans Deakin and Company]] Limited in [[Brisbane]] on 3 June 1943. She was launched on 31 October 1944, and commissioned into the RAN on 17 December 1945. She named for the [[Murchison River (Western Australia)|Murchison River]] in [[Western Australia]].<ref name=SPC>{{cite web |url=http://www.navy.gov.au/hmas-murchison-i |title=HMAS Murchison |accessdate=15 September 2008 |publisher=Sea Power Centre Australia}}</ref> ==Operational history== Completed too late in the war to take part in the fighting, ''Murchison'' began her career by visiting [[Morotai]], [[Ternate]], and the [[Sulawesi|Celebes]] for surveillance duties and [[War Graves Commission]] tasks, before sailing to Japan and joining the [[British Commonwealth Occupation Force]]. The frigate returned to Australia in May 1946.<ref name=SPC/> ''Murchison'' later saw extensive operational service during the [[Korean War]] and was involved in the [[Naval Battle of Han River (1951)|Naval Battle of Han River]] on 28–30 September 1951, during which she was heavily engaged by Chinese shore installations while conducting riverine operations. Four sailors were wounded in the encounter, while ''Murchison'' destroyed a number of Chinese gun positions.<ref>Coulthard-Clark 2001, p. 265.</ref> The frigate was awarded the [[battle honour]] "Korea 1951–52" for her actions during the war.<ref name=newhonours>{{cite news |url=http://www.navy.gov.au/Navy_Marks_109th_Birthday_With_Historic_Changes_To_Battle_Honours |title=Navy Marks 109th
